body:
Hello @diegosancarmen, I'd encourage you to have a look at the docs [here](https://deeplabcut.github.io/DeepLabCut/docs/maDLC_UserGuide.html#decision-point), and what functions could be used to help you/us diagnose what is happening. Getting an empty tracklet file is not a result of corrupted videos, but of very poor tracking (which may come at the root from inaccurate detections).  `deeplabcut.create_video_with_all_detections` would help you determine whether model detections look pretty. Then bear in mind that when using `analyze_videos` with the default `auto_track=True`, DeepLabCut uses settings that were found to work well across projects, but yours may be different.
When you say that you've previously had it working, was it with a different DLC version?

> When you say that you've previously had it working, was it with a different DLC version? It was the same DLC version (2.2.1) on the same Google Colab notebook, with the same videos, just a few days ago (05/27). Running the below function from the [docs](https://deeplabcut.github.io/DeepLabCut/docs/maDLC_UserGuide.html#decision-point): ``` scorername = deeplabcut.analyze_videos(config_path,['/fullpath/project/videos/testVideo.mp4'], videotype='.mp4') deeplabcut.create_video_with_all_detections(config_path, ['/fullpath/project/videos/testVideo.mp4'], videotype='.mp4') ``` I get an error message
OS Error Using snapshot-20000 for model /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/dlc-models/iteration-0/Trial9May23-trainset95shuffle1 Activating extracting of PAFs Analyzing all the videos in the directory... Starting to analyze % /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos/FILE0595_C1_pre-aCSF_TrimA_Trim.mp4 Video already analyzed! /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos/FILE0595_C1_pre-aCSF_TrimA_TrimDLC_resnet50_Trial9May23shuffle1_20000.h5 Using snapshot-20000 for model /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/dlc-models/iteration-0/Trial9May23-trainset95shuffle1 Processing... /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos/FILE0595_C1_pre-aCSF_TrimA_Trim.mp4 Tracklets already computed /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos/FILE0595_C1_pre-aCSF_TrimA_TrimDLC_resnet50_Trial9May23shuffle1_20000_el.pickle Set overwrite = True to overwrite. The tracklets were created (i.e., under the hood deeplabcut.convert_detections2tracklets was run). Now you can 'refine_tracklets' in the GUI, or run 'deeplabcut.stitch_tracklets'. Processing... /content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos/FILE0595_C1_pre-aCSF_TrimA_Trim.mp4 --------------------------------------------------------------------------- OSError Traceback (most recent call last) [](https://localhost:8080/#) in () ----> 1 scorername = deeplabcut.analyze_videos(path_config_file,videofile_path, videotype='.mp4') 2 deeplabcut.create_video_with_all_detections(path_config_file, videofile_path, videotype='.mp4') <<<4 frames>>> [/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/deeplabcut/refine_training_dataset/stitch.py](https://localhost:8080/#) in __init__(self, tracklets, n_tracks, min_length, split_tracklets, prestitch_residuals) 460 461 if not len(self.tracklets): --> 462 raise IOError("Tracklets are empty.") 463 464 if prestitch_residuals: OSError: Tracklets are empty.
... So I'm not really able to run either `deeplabcut.analyze_videos()` or `deeplabcut.create_video_with_all_detections()` Upon using `deeplabcut.utils.plot_edge_affinity_distributions()` with the pickle file from the evaluation results, I got the attached plot of histograms. I'm not sure how to interpret it. Also attached are the values from the `Combined_Evaluation-results.csv` file.
Attached Files (the image seems to be using a transparent background; I ran the image using both dark/light mode and after pasting it here to GitHub it still is hard to view) | | Training iterations: | %Training dataset | Shuffle number | Train error(px) | Test error(px) | p-cutoff used | Train error with p-cutoff | Test error with p-cutoff | |--- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | |0 | 20000| 95 | 1 | 2.59 | 3.88 | 0.3 | 2.59 | 3.88|
> Then bear in mind that when using analyze_videos with the default auto_track=True, DeepLabCut uses settings that were found to work well across projects, but yours may be different. I apologize for not mentioning beforehand, this is a single-animal project.

I do not understand: if it is a single-animal project, there is no tracking nor stitching stages, so you would not be getting the error you report. Is it a multi-animal project to track only one individual?
Can you check that alongside your video file you find a _full.pickle file? This should allow you to run `deeplabcut.create_video_with_all_detections(config_path, ['/fullpath/project/videos/testVideo.mp4'], videotype='.mp4')`

Hmm. Not sure what happened but it seems that I've figured a way to make the program keep running. If I run `deeplabcut.analyze_videos()` and `deeplabcut.create_video_with_all_detections()` I get multiple errors such as the one below. After getting stuck on the first video it starts to analyze, DLC does not proceed further.
Error Message Analyzing all the videos in the directory... Creating labeled video for FILE0595_C1_pre-aCSF --------------------------------------------------------------------------- FileNotFoundError Traceback (most recent call last) [/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/deeplabcut/utils/auxfun_multianimal.py](https://localhost:8080/#) in LoadFullMultiAnimalData(dataname) 206 try: --> 207 with open(data_file, "rb") as handle: 208 data = pickle.load(handle) FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/content/drive/My Drive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos/FILE0595_C1_pre-aCSFDLC_resnet50_Trial9May23shuffle1_20000_full.pickle' During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred: error Traceback (most recent call last) 5 frames [/usr/lib/python3.7/dbm/__init__.py](https://localhost:8080/#) in open(file, flag, mode) 83 mod = _defaultmod 84 else: ---> 85 raise error[0]("need 'c' or 'n' flag to open new db") 86 elif result == "": 87 # db type cannot be determined error: need 'c' or 'n' flag to open new db
However, if I call for the specific `'/fullpath/project/videos/testVideo.mp4'` in each of those functions, the program runs smoothly. Meaning, I still get the aforementioned tracklet error, but I can move forward and create a labeled video (note: the video did indeed show that the program needs much more training). I wonder if this is an issue caused by the single-animal nature of this project? I would not like to have to call for every single full path to each video that I analyze, but that appears to be necessary with the current setup. In regards to being single-animal, the config file states `multi_animal = True` as per the [video tutorial](https://youtu.be/JDsa8R5J0nQ?t=77) for single animal use. When I created the project I did change the config template so that there is only one individual; is there anything else I might be missing?

Also, due to the tracker error popping up and stopping the code block from running, neither an h5 or csv file with the tracked coordinates is created. So although I'm able to produce a labeled video, I can't access the coordinates.

When I try to run `deeplabcut.create_labeled_video` on a video file after analysis, it runs the code block without interruption but there is no video produced.  The output, rather, is as follows:

```
Starting to process video: /content/drive/MyDrive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos/FILE1077_D194_A2_aMSH_Trim_Consistent_Trim.mp4
Loading /content/drive/MyDrive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos/FILE1077_D194_A2_aMSH_Trim_Consistent_Trim.mp4 and data.
No unfiltered data file found in /content/drive/MyDrive/DeepLabCut/Trial9B-JDC-2022-05-23/videos for video FILE1077_D194_A2_aMSH_Trim_Consistent_Trim and scorer DLC_resnet50_Trial9May23shuffle1_20000 and ellipse tracker.
```

To be honest, I'd have probably started with a single-animal DeepLabCut project: the workflow is simpler, and it's unclear whether you'll benefit from the specificity of multi-animal processing.
That being said, I am really confused: how could you create a labeled video if DeepLabCut previously indicated that no tracklets were found. Do you mean `deeplabcut.create_labeled_video` or `deeplabcut.create_video_with_all_detections()`? If the video shows that you need to train your model longer, this should be your first concern: the docs do say clearly that it is vital that detections look good before moving forward.
Specific to the tracklet error though, make sure `topktoretain: 1` in the dlc-models/test/inference_cfg.yaml config file.

Could you clarify what you mean by starting with a single-animal DLC project?  I followed the tutorial in the [video](https://youtu.be/JDsa8R5J0nQ?t=77) I linked above.  Is that then not the correct protocol?

I've also been using [this](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/examples/COLAB/COLAB_YOURDATA_TrainNetwork_VideoAnalysis.ipynb) Google Colab notebook.

> That being said, I am really confused: how could you create a labeled video if DeepLabCut previously indicated that no tracklets were found. Do you mean `deeplabcut.create_labeled_video` or `deeplabcut.create_video_with_all_detections()`? If the video shows that you need to train your model longer, this should be your first concern: the docs do say clearly that it is vital that detections look good before moving forward.

... What I meant to say is that the code block for `deeplabcut.create_labeled_video` ran but did **not** create a labeled video, and it instead returned that aforementioned output.  
`deeplabcut.create_video_with_all_detections()` worked properly.

issue.title: deeplabcut.create_labeled_video() not working

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

- The video isn't corrupt.  I checked that running the `from deeplabcut.utils.auxfun_videos import VideoReader` function already.
- When I run `deeplabcut.create_video_with_all_detections()` I get a video with good detections, albeit there is still room for improvement.
- This is iteration #98500.  At #50000 the labeled video was showing pretty decent labeling with a `pcutoff = 0.4`.  But now I'm not even seeing anything of the mouse labeled.  The only points are the ones of the rod.  Screenshot attached.
- The evaluation results of the pixel error have improved from `snapshot-50000`.  So why aren't the labels showing up in the video?  eval csv also attached.

### Operating System

Google Colab

### DeepLabCut version

2.2.1

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

Google Colab Pro GPU

### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Anything else?

**Snapshot 20000 Labeled**
![snapshot-20000 - labeled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/101142209/173288559-b077d970-6b00-4093-918e-c967fd571640.png)
**Snapshot 98500 All Detections**
![snapshot-98500 - all detections](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/101142209/173288565-ecbc8079-34ca-44f1-9401-832bd640edce.png)
**Snapshot 98500 Labeled**
![snapshot-98500 - labeled](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/101142209/173288568-909f7a3d-2ca0-43bf-9fe3-40506df967f3.png)
[DLC_resnet50_Trial9May23shuffle1_50000-results.csv](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/files/8888237/DLC_resnet50_Trial9May23shuffle1_50000-results.csv)
[DLC_resnet50_Trial9May23shuffle1_98500-results.csv](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/files/8888238/DLC_resnet50_Trial9May23shuffle1_98500-results.csv)
